content.description: Climb a nice featured line on the right end of the south face just left of the blunt SE arete. The rock at the top out is a little suspect.
content.location:
The Positive Energy Boulder is located near the southwest corner of the bouldering area. The south face is distinctly vertical and colorful.

Walk/scramble off the backside to the right.

content.description: Climb the NW arete and west face of the Positive Energy Boulder. Nice low angle rock.
content.protection: Pad or spotter, but just don't fall.
content.location: NW corner of the Positive Energy Boulder

content.description: Climb the huge pointed boulder/pinnacle NW from the main wall. Ascend via the west ridge to the small summit.
content.protection: Uh, almost nothing. Didn't find anything on the summit that looked like a bolt. Best to solo and downclimb, but I wouldn't recommend it. You could simul-rappel if you're comfortable with that.
content.location: West ridge of the pinnacle. Scramble past the low cliffband to the base of the rock.

content.description: Climb the fin/flake to easier ground and top out. Crux is getting off the ground.
content.location: Walk left along the low cliffline until it disappears into the rhodo. The Jerk is the last feasible line, a thin, tall flake/arete just left of a boulder capping a recess.

content.description: Undercling the obvious arching feature, make a move to a sloping pocket, top out.
content.location:
On the west end of the low rocky ridge, below the west ridge of Minas Ithil, look for a "frowning" feature that you can undercling. Walk off left or right.

Also, this is just right of a wide, short dihedral.

content.description: Climb the striking arete on the southeast corner of the boulder to the summit.
content.location: From the route Punch Myself this is the first good sized boulder along the low ridge to the west. Downclimb an easier route to descend.
